Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine - does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Makk28
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at Easter in family room. Room clean and comfortable and more than adequate for our needs. Got free wi-fi as husband is platinum member so that was an unexpected bonus. Breakfast is free and fine - lots of choice and plenty of it so what more can you ask for! Staff were friendly and helpful. Location is very good - 5 mins from underground station and also close to restaurants in Poblu Neu area. We arrived Sunday noon and walked all the way to the sea - not far at all. The general area looks a little iffy but nothing to cause undue concern- you need to keep your wits about you wherever you are in Barcelona. Yes there's graffiti but I think the area is on the up. One thing- the hotel can be hard to spot at first as the green HIE sign is not obvious and the building looks like ( and probably was) an office block. The bar area is a bit bleak but who needs that when you've been out in he city. All in all good value especially if using your free nights as a loyalty club member. Would definitely return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Squiddz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here, alone, for 3 nights at the beginning of April. I was very happy to be in a neighborhood away from the main tourist area. I don't know why one reviewer took taxis everywhere, the Metro is clean, felt safe, and was easy to navigate (IMHO). Just a few minutes on the Metro and you are right where you want to be at the tourist areas. Hotel was standard HIE, street noise not too bad. Breakfast decent, very crowded. Good TV and wifi. I personally had no trouble with pickpockets at all. I found Barcelona easy to navigate, even though there wasn't a lot of English spoken. The city sports many signs pointing tourists to what they want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Decent H/INN Express”
Reviews.Author: choo-choodaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights over easter weekend.Staff very friendly and accomodating,rooms were typical h/inn express,nothing to shout about,clean and modern,.....bed wasnt to comfortable and the shower pressure was terrible,other than that it was ok. Hotel is "out of the way" of the main drag which is fine,good transport links to the city,yellow line "Llacuna" metro station 5 minutes walk away,also there is the tram about 10 mins walk away,just turn left out of the hotel and walk all the way down llacuna street,u cant miss it!There is also a "glorious" shopping centre near the tram stop,it has a starbucks where we went each morning for our dose of caffine!!!!!,staff were friendly and understood english no problem.Also when u arrive at barcelona airport,get the train into the city,its cheap and fast,purchase a T-10 ticket which u can use on all the metro,trams and trains to/from airport, a bargain at 9.85 Euros. Overall we had a great time in Barca,.......one note of caution,be aware of pickpockets,keep your wallet/purse close to hand,be sensible and you will have no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a quiet part of town”
Reviews.Author: pamseattle
Reviews.Content: We stay at the hotel for 4 nights. We arrived on the day of the national strike so we were glad that we weren't in the middle of town. The hotel was modern and clean. The room was small and pretty bared. Bring your own shampoo/conditioner because all they had was shower gel for everything. Breakfast was ok and the same menu for 4 mornings we were there. We stayed there because we were IHG member. We did not know until the third day that as a gold member we supposed to get free wi fi - our children paid for the first 2 days. This hotel is good for business travelers or for overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Came back stayed and loved it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bcirish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for almost a week in October 2011 and absolutely fell in love with the hotel the people and the area. The next time we go back we will stay there again. It is not in the middle of all of the insanity of tourists which for me is a huge plus. We found the room quite comfortable, the breakfast very generous and tasty and as always good staff -extremely kind helpful and multilingual. The bed was comfortable and the room was well equipped. The shower was good and although the view was so so the sunrise out our window every morning was excellent. Accessible to beach, hop on hop off bus, neighborhood restaurants, bakeries, vegetable stands, butcher shops, grocery store, specialty shops, large mall, unique cozy restaurants, parks and local ambience. Now details of the area. It is in an area near the University and also catering to business and located in a charming neighborhood. Every day was a new experience. We went to one of the restaurants and liked the food and when we went back two days later the waiter welcomed us back and remembered even what we drank. Each day the local residents came out and walked to the local stores for groceries sat on the park benches and visited, walked their dogs, waited at the end of the day to pick up children from school, stopped for a drink at the outdoor cafes and often came back out when the streetlights went on for dinner. The grocery store was the source of our munchies for the duration of our stay - what a fun experience - also found great good tasting cheap wine there and I am picky!!!! Each day we walked several blocks and picked up an on off bus to explore the touristy areas of Barcelona. At the end of the day we walked home and discovered a new restaurant or little neighborhood bar. We were not far from the Bullet and the tram. We did walked to Gaudi but it was a bit of a hikealthough we enjoyed the adventure. We went to the beach each day on our walks - probably about 5-6 blocks and there were extensive parks there also. When we went to Barcelona the first time - I did not really care for Barcelona at all - too many tourists and too much traffic. By the time we left, I was falling in love with the neighborhood in which this hotel is located and still not liking Barcelona so much. The return this past fall changed all of that. Now I like it all!!! I travel independently with my DH and find larger cities far more enjoyable when I can experience the local culture which to me is in essence what a travel is all about. I hope that this might help you. Just a bit of a heads up - do not be put off by the local graffiti nearby - I spent a great deal of time trying to capture the essence of the work. Very sophisticated. Just writing this has made me long to return and linger there among these wonderful people again

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel and only 10 min from the seaside”
Reviews.Author: 66-Route
Reviews.Content: When I visit Barcelona as "IHG" traveller I stay at this hotel. Not far from the sea. Mercadona supermarket located next to the hotel. Overall clean and tidy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: CathyP488
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in April. The hotel itself is fine, a typical HI, with a mediocre breakfast that was pretty crowded every morning. The location however was not great for a family of tourists. It is pretty far from the sights and we ended up taking taxis everywhere (which are plentiful and fairly easy to find. except after the FC Barcelona match). It is, however, not a bad walk to the water, but still sort of far from the tourist sights such at the Aquarium and Harbor area.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay, NOT SAFE”
Reviews.Author: randy p
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed after our cruise at this hotel. Way out of the way but this is not the bad review. I fell out of the bathtub/shower because of several reasons, no anti-slip in tub, door does not shut safely, and the safety handle was already broken when I tried to stop my fall. The safety handle was only pushed in. But the topper is , I SUBMITTED an accident report on the morning of accident 09/26/2011. After many e mails from me to them, I have not received any e mail, letters, or a phone call. Have not received sorry, are you alright, nothing from them. In my opion unsafe and definately DO NOT care about Americans or this is just the way business is done by HOLIDAY INN EXPRESS BARCELONA, SPAIN

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, bad bed!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTexans2
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly, the area safe & the rooms clean but in dire need of renovation. (FYI: No bar soap or lotion, just bottle on the wall and instant coffee only in the room). Maybe it was just our bed (room#631) but it was so bad that I think the bed springs are still imprinted in our backs! The view was not good (empty lot with graffitti) but it's Barcelona so we were rarely in the room. 2 blocks away is a charming street (Poblenou) that is a nice walk to the beach that leads all the way into old town. Airport is about 40 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: redzorba
Reviews.Content: ideal place away from the tourist area but handy for transport into city centre use metro stn Llacuna for a quick trip to town area around there is a bit run down but always felt safe hotel staff very friendly supermarket 1 min away for snacks but the best place nearbye is Poblenou also known as little ramblers plenty of places to eat and drink and watch the world go by you most probably be the only tourist there,as its used by the locals ,beach is 15 mins walk and what a beach with beach bars at reasonable prices as is the prices in poblenou,a shopping mall is also handy on the via diagonale,if you want to go native this is the place for you when we go back to Barca this is the place for us

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, amazing value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Brazililli
Reviews.Content: Free nice breakfast (don't be shy and make a sandwich for the road if you're on a budget), steps from a grocery store, internet at the lobby or in your room for a fee (12 Euros), beautiful area of town and short walk to the beach and lots of bars, cafes and restaurants...full of locals living their regular life and a treat to watch. Banks nearby too. Everything you need! The rooms were very comfortable and pretty quiet but choose the back of the hotel not the front. The windows open, which is great! Nice bathroom. Nice staff. I really enjoyed it and will go back there next time. Close to metro too and taxis are always at the front. You can ask the front desk for a plug in for your eletronics if you don't have one. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheLong
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, all facilities included Outrages price for wireless Internet (should have been included in the price)

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Barcelona in early February 2012. From the airport to the hotel, it was about 20 - 25 minutes / 30 - 35 Euros taxi ride, depending on the traffic. I assume it is possible to get here by public transit; the closest subway station is about 2 block away, Llacuna on the L4 / yellow line, offering great access to the downtown, club district, and the port area. Keep in mind that even cabs that claim to be able to use credit cards may revert back to cash once at destination. On 2 out of 5 taxi rides the card readers did not connect properly. The downtown is 5 or 6 stations away. As I was travelling with colleagues, we used a T10 pass, 9.95 Euros, basically 10 rides that can be shared. There is also a day pass that is 6.95euros if you plan a lot of subway riding. The hotel is clean and seems to be very popular with families, and groups, young groups for the most part. The internet works very well, it was included in the room rate, along with the breakfast. It was not apparent that this hotel is heavily used by business travelers, but it does offer all that is needed if you are on a business trip. Street noise was not an issue at least not in the room I had, however there seems to be quite a bit of noise transfer from other rooms, especially just before bed time and in the morning (lots of families with young children) and because of the younger crowd there was a lot of cell phone talking in the corridors. Breakfast was excellent, offering a wide range of options, for both food and drinks, hot and cold. Overall, the hotel was good value for the 85euros rate we paid. It is a 3 star so do not expect a lot of pampering. The staff delivered far more than the 3 stars, providing great service and lots of help at every interaction. One evening I overheard a conversation between a customer and the reception desk, where the customer was complaining that the food they received in their room service was not as they ordered, and they were very hungry. Word of advice, do not use the room service (not that I am saying their food is bad…), be reasonable and go to one of the many restaurant that are less than 50 meters away. There is also a grocery store 20 meters away from the hotel, and on the opposite side of the roundabout there is a convenience store. At least 6 or 7 more deli type food stores within another 100 meters. Absolutely no need for room service…. I would definitely recommend this hotel for business, families, singles, friends, couples as long as there is an understanding that this is a utilitarian hotel in a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Mostynboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights this week during a business trip. Hotel is well located. Clean, comfortable rooms. Staff are great - realy helpful and friendly. Breakfast is very limited but free so no complaints. At €79 per night, the hotel is great value and is great for short stay business trips but I would not stay here for on a tourist trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, affordable prices”
Reviews.Author: strandman46
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for three nights in January '12. Nice clean rooms, the beds were rather hard, the people at the reception were friendly and helpfull. Breakfast was excellent, one morning the room was rather crowded, other mornings we had lots of room. The hotel is located in a quiet surrounding with former factories an new buildings. Metro is about 400 mtrs, supermarket and lots of restaurants next block. We liked Barcelona and when we shall return this hotel will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and fair price”
Reviews.Author: Eugenius58
Reviews.Content: It still need a refurbishment and decent closests in the room. breakfast The breakfast is limited to a cold meal and fresh fruits and vegetables are provided only occasionally. Location is very good. Hotel is modern and has a little futuristic design.

Reviews.Title: “Two stays in 10 days tells it all ! Many more stays to come !”
Reviews.Author: N0rwegianTravellers
Reviews.Content: As some of my readers has noted , I am a member of the Holiday Inn Chain, www.ichotels.com, so I try to book most of my stays with them, so I get free upgrades and therefore better rooms. In this hotel there are only two types of room, but it does help for other hotels in the chain. It is the first time I have stayed here and I booked first 4 nights, a couple of other nights somewhere else, see my other reviews, and another 3 nights in January. The hotel is basic standard with an adequate sized rooms. I choose this hotel as I wanted to be close to the beach for my daily runs, and exploring a new area Poble Nou. I am very happy with my choice as the rates are great , breakfast OK and the Rambla Poble Nou is a nice walking street with some nice cafe's and restaurants. I have been to Barcelona about 40-60 times over the last 30 years and I have lived here twice in the 80's. This area is not very visited by tourists, so the prices are lower here and it gives you a better feel of a local area. I did most of my shopping at Mercadona store 100 meter from the hotel on your left, where I bought my food and drinks everyday. There are lots of bread shops around the area , where you can get your daily bread at a very good price. On the parallel street Maria Aguilo on the left side of Rambla Poble Nou, you will find the local market hall with various options to buy. In the same street I found my Internet store where 1 hour cost 1 Euro and you could buy more hours and the prices was then even lower. For example 4 hours for 3 Euros. This store was in the street Maria Aguilo close to the market and it was also possible to phone and use Skype. The breakfast room get very busy after 9am , so try to get down earlier. Thank God there are no bacon, egg or old sausages, so if like this stuff, choose somewhere else. However, the breakfast is good enough for me, and it seems that most people enjoyed it. In 2013, there will open a Travelodge further down the road, so then even more people will have the chance to explore this area. I will be back for the summer !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for very short stay - not the best place to explore BCN”
Reviews.Author: xichic
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent one night here using our reward pionts before boarding a cruise the next day. The hotel was quaint, in a quiet area of Barcelona. It is two blocks from the train station so it has easy access to all the different areas of Barcelona. They had a great complimentary breakfast which was a nice touch. The bed was quite hard, which made for an average night sleep. I would not sleep here for more than one or two nights max. The bathroom was clean, though extremely small. If you are taking a cruise, this hotel is about a 40 euro taxi ride from the terminal. This is good information as I thought I was a bit closer to the terminal by staying at this hotel, but I was incorrect. The great thing of this hotel is they are very accomodating, and they let you keep your luggage in their storage room if you need to. Overall, good hotel for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “overall a good family hotel”
Reviews.Author: marinosCyprus
Reviews.Content: clean comfortable.good size rooms . Very good breakfast. The metro station is just 5 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, it busy and a little far from attractions!”
Reviews.Author: christina p
Reviews.Content: A clean and well maintained building. Basic cold buffet breakfast. Staff are helpful but not very informative. Very far from attractions had to keep using public transport to get around. Not many places near by to eat. Although I would say the beach is a nice ten min walk.. So goo if you want to go to the beach every day. Rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff - hotel not much - odd location”
Reviews.Author: BlueHenFlyer
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel in what I'm sure someone is trying to sell as an up and coming (although it doesn't appear to be going anywhere) location. The staff was great, breakfast was OK, the price was good. The location was out of the way - night time action was limited and it did get painful to continually connect on the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: Chiguire
Reviews.Content: Pluses: Clean hotel overall. Friendly and responsive staff. In a relatively safe and quiet neighborhood, and not too far from Metro or Tram stations. There is a decent breakfast buffet, which is included in the nightly rate. The nightly rate is very affordable. Minuses: The telephone buttons are confusing. I had an extra local call charged because I didn't understand the graphics on the buttons. Internet is available, reliable and fast, but is not free. There is a charge associated with both Wi-Fi and in-Lobby use. Reportedly, wakeup calls are also charged. No clear-cut directions as to what in the TV costs extra, and what is free. There is no restaurant, gym, or pool. The hotel can be a little difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Barcelona, has all you need”
Reviews.Author: Loquif
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great rooms, clean, pretty and new. Great breakfast. The female staff at the reception desk is so so, they are not very friendly. Security box for your valuables is available but they charge 300 euros if you loose the key, that's crazy, especially because is not written anywhere. Hotel location is very good, even though it is not in the city centre, there is easy access to public transport. There is also a supermarket a block away from the hotel, which is very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Almost on the Seaside”
Reviews.Author: Patricia D
Reviews.Content: Great location! Close to subway, or a bus stop-the bus takes you downtown (placa Catalunya). A very nice walking area with restaurants, bars and small clothing shops, shoe stores, hairdressers etc. Sea is 4 blocks down, the Cigar is also within walking distance. Diagonal Mar shopping center is several tram stops away. Rooms in the hotel are ok size for two, pretty good for one person. Coffee-and tea maker in the room. Safe box would be nice to have in-room, not only at reception desk. Breakfast is included in rate, has variety if you stay longer than two nights. It was my second time in Barcelona, staying here and as I get to more the city, I still think it is a great place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: mramos29
Reviews.Content: This is the third Holyday Inn Express we stay in and, as expected, this hotel was great value for money. I doubt we would be able to find a better family room in Barcelona for only 80 euros a night. The room was comfortable and the breakfast was very nice. We had a little issue that was promptly and kindly solved by the staff. On the other hand, the hotel is very well located: just 3 minutes away from Llacuna Metro station which is just a few stations away from city centre. Nearby, there's the Rambla del Pobleneu with all kinds of stores. By the way, it's a great walk to the beach. When I get back to Barcelona, I won't have to choose any other hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel that we have visited many times”
Reviews.Author: Rams_fan_11
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for the last 4 years as we have found it to be one of the best hotels in Barcelona. The rooms are big enough for a family of 4 without it being too much of a squeeze. The hotel is in an area which is being renovated and it is nice being slightly out of the city itself. Breakfast can be a little stressful as the area is always busy and you can sometimes fight for a table if you hit it at the wrong time. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the beach and just around the corner is a supermarket and a range of bars and restaurants. I would always stay at this hotel when we visit Barcelona as it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Hgrewal13
Reviews.Content: It was just fine as we were to stay there for one night , we had to take cruise ship the next day.it was hard to find as cab driver couldn't find it on his gps,Rooms were not very big but perfect to sleep,all facilities were there in the room, free inter net was offered bcz. rooms were not ready upon arrival,free breakfast included with lots of different variety of fruits juices ,breads cereals etc.It was hard to get room in spain where your kids can stay with you they prefer separate rooms for kids or you pay a lot if you have to keep your children in same room.washrooms were clean with all modren access ,you just walk three to four minutes to get a train and then all the things like down town and other places are easy to reach.staff was good & helpfull also speaks & understand english otherwise language is the major problem there,even the signs and menus are in spanish.In room you had iron ,TV,nice clean linens which is most important clean & enough towels,sugesstions are that always confirm with cab driver that if he knows the location otherwise they keep driving & you end up paying more,but if something is disputed , take the person to front desk & staff helps you in translating and solves the problem.Our rooms had a small fridge too with drinks but you pay more if you use them.As compare to other hotels price was very reasonable with same facilities , you also get

Reviews.Title: “Lovely week”
Reviews.Author: aslitsa
Reviews.Content: Hotel was exactly as we were waiting.. Staff was helpful and friendly.. Room was bigger than i thought, bed was perfect (not very soft- not very hard). I love drinking tea when i watch tv and this was posible because room has kettle with tea and coffee.. Breakfast was very good. The only thing that we didn't like was the lobby..Is durk and it doesn't remind you as an entrance of a Hotel..Flowers or floor lamp and few magazines would be very nice there. Tips: How you can get to the hotel from the airport. 1. You take a free bus from airport to the train station 2. Then you take the train to the Sants Estacio station 3. From Sants Estacio station you take metro L5(blue line) to Verdaguer station 4. From Verdaguer station you take metro L4(yellow line) to Llacuna 5. And at 5' you are at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable hotel in a unfavorable area”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller1985
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a weird entrance. You need to use the elevator to get to the reception. The lobby is very unfriendly and dark at night and the elevators are old. The staff were very nice however and they acknowledged priority club members. Location: The area looks a bit hostile at dark. The surrounding is not very welcoming and you wouldnt feel safe walking around. The closest tube is 5 min walk. Staff and Service: Very nice and polite and very helpful. Room: Dark with old furniture and noisy uncomfortable bed. Food: The breakfast is included in the rate but it's average at its best. Price: I stayed at 110 Euros a night. You can get better hotel which are more central with that rate. anything below 80 Euros a night would be more reasonable for the room you get. Would I stay there again? Possible not. I would try to go to more central hotels.

Reviews.Title: “quick weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: salisbury1st
Reviews.Content: Had a long weekend here, it was fine just like any holiday inn express anywhere. reasonable standard for everything. location was good about half hour walk the centre or a quick taxi ride

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what is says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia162
Reviews.Content: My family and I (me, my husband and our 2 teenage children stayed here for 2 nights in October. First impressions of the area were that of a residential/business area, which is obviously in the process of being rejuvenated - I likened it to Docklands area in London about 5 - 10 years ago, but it was very quiet at night, as there did not seem to be a lot else around. The hotel was about a 5-7 minute walk from Llacuna metro station, which gave easy access to the whole of Barcelona. Rooms were clean and spacious - we had two interconnecting rooms - beds were not very comfortable at all; mattresses were very hard and although there were a choice of pillow softness, it seemed to be a case of 1 pillow was not enough, but 2 was too many. Breakfast was of a good standard lots of choice - fruit juices and hot drinks from dispenser, cereals, yoghurts, bread, cheese, fruit - eat as much as you like in a canteen style environment; find a seat, eat and then clear up after yourself. If you were travelling on a budget and only want to use this as a base to sleep and to eat breakfast, for the price this would be a perfect hotel to use. We all felt perfectly safe walking back from Metro station in the dark; we passed a couple of restaurants on the way and there was a supermarket right outside Llacuna station. First impressions were that the area has been a bit run down in the past, but within a few years this is likely to change. All in all a good experience was had here and if all Holiday Inn Express are of this standard, I would have no hesitation to stay at another. One tip for transfer to and from airport, buy a T10 ticket, cost is 8, 25 Euros which gave 10 (1 hour 15 minute) trips on the metro - you can share this ticket with all the people in your party and 1 trip included travel from Barcelona - we went from Llacuna all the way to the airport, via Passaig de Gracia (unbelievable but true for 3, 30 Euros). Got our ticket from an attendant rather than a machine so must be accurate - there were 4 of us travelling so this was the most cost effective way. I presume for a single traveller, you could buy a single metro ticket for 1, 40 Euros. Our taxi cost 30 Euros so the fact that the Metro cost us 3.30 Euros for 4 was a bargain. Visited many of the sights - don't bother with Sagrada Familia at night, felt uncomfortable as it was so far out from the main shopping area and it wasn’t even lit up, but great in the day. If you have time, visit Montserrat by train, a fantastic day out; very interesting and beautiful views and also the Mercat de La Boqueria on La Rambla- it is an extraordinary market. All in all we had a fantastic time, Barcelona was a fantastic place to visit - one which I would go back to again in a flash; we stayed in a good hotel, I liked the area as it was quiet, but the location could require the use of the Metro to all the main sights unless you want a considerable walk; about 15 minutes walk from the beach and at least a 30 minute walk to the cable car over the port. I just wish the bed had been softer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smhbokhari
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days in September 2011. The location of this hotel is fantastic. Come out of the hotel and go left and everything is there. Supermarket approx 150m which is in a rambles loads of shops, banks restaurants etc. Barclays branch can be found there. Barcelona beach is 15 mins walk and there is two metro stations within 10 mins. The hotel is good, but it's an express so no room service. There is an ice dispenser and vending machines. Breakfast is continental. The staff are efficient and friendly. I would recommend it for the location

Reviews.Title: “Nice new clean hotel in safe and friendly middle class neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: charlesp
Reviews.Content: Modern and spotless property in a safe and quiet middle class neighbourhood. If you can get the night price, this is a very practical place to stay although it lacks ambiance and the principal sights are not within walking distance. However, this well run and comfortable hotel has no pretences about being charming, romantic or located near to the commercial or touristic sights (so any criticism for it failing to meet these expectations is ill deserved.) Having said this, it's a $15 cab ride from anywhere you would want to go, it's near a metro line and the neighbourhood ramblas is full of places to eat a stone's throw away.

Reviews.Title: “Low cost hotel for price that is not so low”
Reviews.Author: Clovicek
Reviews.Content: Positive comments: - Very close to subway and 15 minute walk to the beaches - Interesting location, ex-industrial part of Barcelona, some will like it, some not - Nice and free breakfast - Helpful staff at the reception Negative comments - First impressions are bad, fells like vacant office building - The hotel is not very clean, the windows are dirty, carpets in walkways with lots of stains - Unpleasant smell in our room and especially in the bathroom - Complicated TV system that pushes paid movies - For 93,- a night, not good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ooresutthu
Reviews.Content: Locality: Is a little lonely in the night... but is just right next to the street with all restaurants so you have a good choice to eat. Also that same street leads to the beach. Average in locality... not a treat to your eyes. Comfort: After spending a week in a rented apartment with not so great beds, this was a treat for us. For a 3 star, it is a good size room and a comfy bed. Service: Staff was friendly and nice. Breakfast: It is always included with the room you take here. But it was a little dissapointing because they dont serve any warm breakfast. So with the kid I would prefer some eggs other warm stuff for breakfast. Overall: It is alright if you know before hand about the location otherwise the stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Value ok. Location poor to scary”
Reviews.Author: jabnolla
Reviews.Content: The rooms are updated and on the small side. Staff was friendly. No washing machines for self service laundry. Breakfast was briskly taken away despite patrons still present in the dinning room. Breakfasst was nothing to write home about. Upon arrival at night realized that the hotel is located in an ugly commercial sector of the city. Quite scary at night. The street level of the hotel is vacant commercial space that is boarded up with storm shutters and full o grafitti. Unacceptable sight. The least they could do is paint over the urban art.. Not a great first impression upon arrival with family. Nothing to sightsee at walking distance. No nightlife either anywhere near. Next time, Willo look for a better location in such a beautiful and vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Taun0
Reviews.Content: I suggest everybody to ignore those bad reviews because there really is nothing to complain about in this hotel. More than nice for a 3-star hotel. Very clean and moderate-sized room and bathroom. At first I thought that the location is too far from the city centre but I was wrong. Llacuna metro-station is just 5 minutes away from the hotel. Rambla del Poblenou is just 200 metres from the hotel. It is Rambla but way cosier and more genuine than La Rambla in the city centre. Past Rambla del Poblenou just 10-15 minutes is the beach. Mercadona grocery store is also just 200 metres right next to Rambla del Poblenou. Hotel offers decent breakfast. PS. With very good croissants :) I would definitely recommend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Easy family trip”
Reviews.Author: BahadirOlcay
Reviews.Content: Visit of big touristic cities may difficult for family of 4. Transportation, security, foods etc. all of them are big and stressful issues for parents. This hotel made it easier for us. The location of hotel a little bit far to touristic attaction but Metro station Llacuna is within 5 minutes to enter Barcelona's efficient subway system. You can easily reach all points of interest in Barcelona. Moreover, this place is in safe residential area to stay. Very close markets to get everything you will need and also close to local la rambla to walk peacefully at the evening. You can experienced local people' life style. All the staffs are helpful and friendly,

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: versipellis
Reviews.Content: I urge all travellers to ignore all the negative comments, do yourselves a very big favour and stay at the Holiday Inn. Everything you want to see and everywhere you want to go is no more than 200 yards from the hotel to your left as you come out. You then reach the wonderful Ramblas de Poblenou, day and night a great place to be with restaurants and cafes and ice cream parlours and shops and near buses and the Metro. The hotel is perfectly adequate, great breakfast buffet, clean and the staff very helpful. You can stay in higher-grade hotels and we did in this troop but you will not find a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: JackieCC895
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and the breakfast was decent. The front desk was staffed by people who were rude and not very accomodating to the guests. The hotel is not in a very nice neighborhood however we were able to walk a few blocks to a place where there were lots of restaurants and shops. People were out strolling enjoying food and drinks at sidewalk cafe's at ten o'clock at night. Quite different from my home town. I would not stay at this hotel again and would certainly not recommend it to anyone. I found that most of the people we encountered were very rude and not at all friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: sashsash
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to the metro, pretty convenient location even though it's not in the centre. Close to the beach. Clean enough. But.....I have nasty little bites all over my body. At first I thought it was an allergic reaction, went to the chemist and thought it was over. However, over the 2 nights, I was bitten again and again and now the bites are infected and terribly itchy. The hotel wasn't fancy, but it did what it said. So I was happy to stay there. However being covered in itchy bites isn't my idea of a nice holiday..... Once I put 2 and 2 together on the last day, I showed my bites to a lady at reception told her of the situation. She asked which room I was in and thanked me for informing them. I only hope that I haven't brought them home with me :(

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every respect”
Reviews.Author: Dcb54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four times four years in a row,every stay superb,great staff,nothing too much trouble.Location between two metro stations(Poblenou better)easy access to town. Stay local and it's own Ramblas has everything you need. Beach 10/15mins stroll away.

Reviews.Title: “Helt okej hotell”
Reviews.Author: Yezzie
Reviews.Content: The rooms were decent size and it was fresh, just what I expected. Missing that there was no minibar or safety box, but it is on the other hand primarily an overnight hotel. Breakfast was okay but so crowded it was! You could be standing in line at the coffee machine for several minutes, and too often it was out of bread and other things.

Reviews.Title: “Its a perfect place to rest”
Reviews.Author: cherry s
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews I was concerned about this hotel but this hotel is fine . As a family of four 12 and 19yrs we had two twin rooms. The rooms are lovely and comfy and clean barcelona is a city to get going and explore so there is no need to waste money on elaborate hotels. We were missing a bag on arrival and Jordi and Myriam were very helpful calling the airline and checking online for updates. Breakfast is busy but just grab a coffee and toast and you are ready to go. a short walk and you are in the ramblas of poblenou and 10 minutes later on a lovely clean and uncrowded beach. We hired a car and travelled all over the town parking is FREE outside the hotel until 31st august in the green zones and many other areas. I would recommend the magic fountain of montjuic which runs thurs-monday 9-11.30pm its amazing. We had a wonderful week in barcelona and if you are careful ordering food e.g stick to the 10euro menu dias it can be very affordable....enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, but competent and clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sharijono
Reviews.Content: A few weeks back I was at this hotel with a group of friends. We had 4 rooms in the hotel and the hotel was fully booked during that period. As expected from a HIX it was a clean property, actually decent sized rooms and well appointed bathrooms with good showers (good pressure and constant temperature). There's no roomservice or restaurant on site, but there's a Supermercado just 1 minute away. The breakfast is very basic with cold meats and cheeses, but it was actually good enough! The location is okay; subway is not too far away and if you have a car, there's plenty of free parking available in the area of the hotel. There's not much around the hotel's area, but everything is 'just a metro ride away'... Platinum members get free internet and a guaranteed 2PM c/o which was a nice touch. There was a vending machine with decent snacks and sandwiches + a drinks machine on the lobby floor which was great for late night cravings or thirsty moments.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel to stay for 1/2 nights or for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: NielsBos
Reviews.Content: nice hotel to stay for 1/2 nights or for a city trip, it is a bit basic, small but clean room + bathroom, located close to Ramblas de Poblenou, nice street with shops, bars + restaurant and lots of locals. breakfast was ok, no restaurant in the hotel but there was a bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for visiting Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: maisymooo
Reviews.Content: Nice new clean hotel in a suburb of Barcelona which is well situated for the metro station and only 5 stops into centre of town. Not much in the surrounding area but I can recommend the local bar Gracia just up from the metro station - great for a sandwich and drinks before heading into town ! the hotel is newly built with an underground car park for 14€ a day. Nice clean rooms with good air conditioning and excellent shower in the bathroom. staff very helpful and free breakfast buffet provided in the morning (continental style only but plenty of choice).

Reviews.Title: “liked it”
Reviews.Author: famil2011y
Reviews.Content: Great if you are traveling with kids. Close to some of the attractions and very close beach. Staff was very helpful. Be aware...walk (5-6 mins) from the metro station to the hotel is smelly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & clean”
Reviews.Author: baquery
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night, the hotel was full but everything was OK. Rooms are comfortable and spacious, and so is the bathroom. Staff are average friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with our stay”
Reviews.Author: 4498Shelly
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews of the hotel on this website so I was prepared for the location of the hotel. Yes, it was in a more residential area; however, it was also a 10-15 minute walk to the beach. This was important to us. We spent a lot of time around the waterfront area. The hotel was clean. The staff was always very nice and very helpful. Our room was nice with a big bathroom. If we ever go back to Barcelona, I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Does what is says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: usman_m_a
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days in this hotel. Rooms are of reasonable size with good bathroom,full tub.LCD TV ,coffee maker but no mini fridge. i only stayed here as i am Holiday Inn Priority member and have been collection point for years. I took this chance to cash in my point have 4 of my 5 night paid for. It is a business hotel with limited services located in the middle of a local community. As such its very quite and peaceful at night.Breakfast is included in room and has sufficient choice for all ,bur no hot items. Reception is the only source for services and are helpful if not busy. No restaurant on premises but good eating places on Rambla Plabneu .5 minutes walk. There are plenty of local stores offering a wide variety of food and drinks. you can either walk to the beach (20 min) or take the tube towards the Olympic village for the poplar beach in town or towards the quite side where the local sun themselves. The metro only 2 min walk from the hotel, offering you quick and easy access to center of town and to the Aero Bus for Airport access. Overall good value for money

Reviews.Title: “They will not honor your reservation”
Reviews.Author: nissanpon1
Reviews.Content: Booked and pre-paid 2 stays in June & July through Travelocity, when we arrived the front desk manager told us they will not honor the Travelocity reservation. Charged us 50 Euros ($75.25) per day of stay for our daughter in the room with us. We stayed 7 days the overcharge was $526.75.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: HowieCA666
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend. People there were friendly, food was goo & the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: petrcze
Reviews.Content: New hotel with good position close to metro station Lacuna. Nice and spacious rooms, friendly staff, breakfasts with large selection. Simply perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Goodroom poor service”
Reviews.Author: Ashok M
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days in this hotel. Rooms are of reasonable size with good bathroom,full tub.LCD TV ( Only 2 english channel) ,coffee maker but no minifridge. Soap+shampoo through dispenser no other toiletaries.It is a business hotel with limited services. Breakfast is included in room and has sufficient choice for vegetarians ,bur no hot items. Reception is the only source for services and are helpful if not busy.Services like A.C./Telephone repair takes a day or so and general advise from reception is to change rooms. No restaurent on premises but good eating places on Rambla Plabneu .5 minutes walk. Beach ( Icarus) is 20 minutes walk on this street. Public transport ( metro) is within 10-15 minutes. About 4 Km from main Rambala amd port. check for airconditioning in the rooms as it may not be working properly. Overall good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you like to walk distances”
Reviews.Author: bcirish
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine. The internet is not free. The breakfast was typical European and there is food nearby. In all honnesty if you are coming to Barcelona to be in the center of activity as a tourist, you will be disappointed because it is not. Everyone is very nice but we stayed for a night to see if we would return in the fall but with the cost of getting to and from the airport - close to 50 euros I am now rethinking putting that expense into a hotel that is closer to the sights of Barcelona. We spent 14 euros to get from the cruise port to the hotel and then 60 to the airport. If we had stayed closer to Ramblas then the cost would have dropped significantly. I would not plan on hauling luggage to the metro for that trip either - too complicated unless you are just bringing a backpack. I had no problems with the hotel but I did have problems with the location as a tourist- wish it had been close enough to walk to some sights because although there are no extras and the outside looks kind of scary when you first see it because of all the grafitti on the building- the staff were nice and the room was fine. I guess it depends on what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “You could get better hotel for the same price”
Reviews.Author: Maheshkhanolkar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in inside lane & may not be safe to go out in the late evening. It is surrounded by earlier gowdowns whihc are not getting converted to commercial premises. The rooms were ok but could have been more clean & neat. Staff was extremely friendly & helpful. Surprisingly the breackfast served was with good continental choice of food. Some Indian restaurants are nearby but I did not get the time to try any of them. Overall good but if you plan your travel in advance you can get better one at good price. As a city Barcelona is quite & clean & excellent local seafood varieties can be tested.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms and only 15 minutes from the city centre”
Reviews.Author: JKhanLondon
Reviews.Content: The room was compact but very clean and adequate for our family of four (children aged 12 & 5). Breakfast menu was standard Holiday Inn Express but it can get a little bit busy. The metro station is only a five minute walk away and you can get into the town centre in only 15 to 20 minutes. All in all we were happy with our stay and If you are going to spend most of your time out and about, then I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “might consider it again”
Reviews.Author: flashncrash
Reviews.Content: we stayed 2 nights after a cruise using some frequent stay points and paying a lower rate. the rooms were spacious, lacks much closet space for hanging clothes. in our room the sink plug didn't have the up/down stem so you had to remove the plug unit manually. don't like the half shower door for the tub, things still get wet. didn't mind the location as Llacuna metro station is 3 zig-sag blocks away but if i visit barcelona again i might consider staying at a place closer to La Rambla. The sleep quality was excellent, not noisy in the area. breakfast was excellent, plenty of options. did appreciate allowing us to check in early. had top floor (6th) room so no possible noise above us.

Reviews.Title: “Good affordable Hotel, exactly what you'd expect from Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: dsadler90
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in for 3 nights in the middle of April. Rooms were Nice and Spacious, with a double bed, Sofa bed and TV. Ensuite bathroom was clean with a good shower. The only thing i would say about the rooms was the wardrobe space was very limited, so if you were staying for longer than a few days you may struggle to find a place to put clothes. Rooms were cleaned everyday to a high standard The Continental Breakfast was nice and filling, with a good choice of cold meats, pastries and cereals. Staff were approachable and friendly. the surrounding area of the hotel was perfect, quite quiet with a supermarket and a street with restaurants just round the corner, and was about a fifteen minute walk to the beach. it's a quiet area at night so no problems with sleeping. there is a metro stop less than five minutes walk away which was perfect to get to the busier parts of the city. Overall, i would certainly recommend this hotel, especially for a short city break

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: otimuresan
Reviews.Content: We were there for a week at the end of march - begining of april. and loved it. Very nice and clean hotel, very friendly and helpfull staff. The breakfast was more very good. Close to the metro station,the supermarket, the restaurants and caffe shops on La Rambla de Poblenou and pretty close to the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Should Only be a Two-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuperTravelDude
Reviews.Content: Apparently HIE CIty 22 has a very different view as to when air conditioning is needed. I would like to think that air conditioning is for when it is hot (which includes April). However, I was told that air conditioning is only for summer, and they told me I could open a window instead. Thanks for nothing HIE City 22! And why is your front desk staff so surly and indifferent too??? Also, the free breakfast is horrible. The coffee was the worst and the food was low quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot not far from metro, but a bit off the city center.”
Reviews.Author: aronuz
Reviews.Content: Don't be surprised if your tv turns on in the morning. Its their wake up call. Rooms are clean. Front desk people might come out slow at first, but are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Inn Express and Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Lexie2028
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn Express is good value for money. Clean, spacious rooms with simplistic amenities. There are no frills here. You get what you pay for. I received the best welcome at a hotel ever...at this hotel. The staff were both helpful and accommodating. The only downside is the rooms which do not provide toiletries except for soap dispensers on the walls. There are no safety deposit boxes in the rooms which is highly disappointing in a city like Barcelona...where we warned time and time again about pickpockets. (However, we didn't have a problem in that department.) Even though the weather is starting to get hot...the air conditioning wasn't turned on and we had to open the window..this resulted in a terrible night's sleep due to the excessive noise outside ALL night. The hotel isn't in the downtown but it is still in a noisy area. The hotel is out of the way but if you don't mind walking or taking the metro/cab...it is in a nice location and close to a Rambla with shops and restaurants. The breakfast is ok. It is Continental so don't expect anything hot or cooked. Overall...we enjoyed our stay here and would stay again, if we couldn't get anything closer to the downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but one can prefer to stay near Centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: rohitkaliyar
Reviews.Content: first of hotel hotel is good neat and clean with all the basic facilities like tea coffee maker etc. however locker in the room was missing the hotel is located far from the city centre and one can find some decent hotels in near la ramblas as the place becomes deserted after 11 pm. breakfast was on poorer side as eggs were not available staff was very good and explained all the locations and gave lots of time to us

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Mid-priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard_BEE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express City-22 for 4 nights in March 2011. The hotel is easily reached from the Llacuna Metro station (5 mins walk), and approx 1.5 miles from Barcelona Old Town. The rooms were typical Holiday Inn Express design, and were left clean every day. Though the tea/coffee wasn't always refilled, we soon got more from Reception. The Breakfasts each morning were of a good standard, with a large choice of fruit/yoghurts/juice/cereals/rolls/pastries/cheese/meats etc. All was self-service, and the staff were busy clearing tables as fast as the could. Couldn't fault the Breakfast at all. There is a small bar too which opens in the evenings. The walk into Barcelona Old Town took around 30 minutes, or you could walk down to the Beach in about 10 minutes and then continue to the Marina or further, not a bad location for a mid-priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and solid breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MussyD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Feb and had a great time. The staff are brilliant especially one called Maria (I think) - she was very helpful and guides, info and all presented in a polite manner. However there was a guy there on our arrival- asked him for a map and he slapped it on the table and when I asked for any others he said he had none. Next morning we asked again and Marie provide all. Buy the tour bus pack - €4 euros! You will get that money back buy using vouchers on the tour bus plus more. If we had it in the first day from that guy we would have saved a bit on first day tours and quick food. But at least we had it for other things we did. Beach is a straight 10-15 min walk - and brilliant. The metro station is around the corner - yellow line, so you can get to city or other places really quick. Buy a T10 metro card about €8. gives you 10 trips on metro bus etc. Read into it for more details - if you pay London prices for tube this is a bargain in comparison!! There is a decent mall about 2 stops away - if you want to do a bit of quiet shopping- forum diagonal. There is so much to do Barcelona all present on maps and guides. Do the sky cart Thingy which I can't believe is not on the top ten attractions list. You get to see beach front views of Barcelona at height so get clicking with the camera. There is a small supermarket near this holiday for quick things. There aren't many great walking eating places near the hotel - just small cafes with not so great food. There is a fraggi close by - Ice creams there are brilliant. All in all connections wise to city centre and other places this holiday is brilliantly located, rooms are clean and noise levels are low to none. Breakfast gets packed because food is plenty and good. Only other thing I found was we very careful with taxis booked from the hotel. The taxi drivers think you are stupid and take you round the bender to make a few bob of you. I had my iPhone and switched on the gps map Thingy to show my current location whistle in a taxi from the hotel. All the taxis drivers we booked from hotel took as in a bender and charged us more for the trip. La Ramba to hotel is about €8-10. going to from hotel by taxi will cost you €15. So be wise!!! Stupid taxi driver that took us to airport charged us almost €50 where coming to hotel cost us €30. Driver as proved by my iPhone took us away from the hotel around the block back past the hotel on an adjacent road then started toasted airport which at this point hit €10 on the clock. Shame on these minor dishonest people in barcelona. If they be honest and take us on a direct route they will always get more tips from me- but not this time!!! Oh people keep saying be careful of pick pockets in barcelona - we had no issues!! We kept things secure! Be secure not stupid!! And you will keep your stuff. That is anywhere in the world you go!!! Have a good trip to this hotel and Barcelona!!!

Reviews.Title: “Busy, connected, nice.”
Reviews.Author: Macierzanka
Reviews.Content: This is a Holiday Inn Express, which means certain level of cleanliness, service, decor (the new HIEx variant, quite nice though you're never sure in which country and city you woke up) and pricing. The hotel is quite busy, we had to book the place well in advance and I recall some people at the reception desk trying to prolong or reserve rooms to no avail. It's easy to get to the city, just a few stops on the metro. The sea is also close, and the area around the hotel is mostly newly-renovated with shops, benches, pedestrian zones etc. Oh, the hotel has a paid parking area in the basement if you need such.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in good location but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: bubka86
Reviews.Content: Very nice and professional young, tall man in reception,helped us whenever we needed help,. Carpets on corridos should be cleaned, room was good cleaned and nice, very comfortable.Area around the hotel is not too pretty. The hotel was in good location to beach and yacht port, also subway not far away. During our last night we asked a portier in reception to give us two wine glasses to our room, and the glasses were just behind his back but he refused sayin that the bar is close. There was no glasses in the room and we had to drink wine using mugs :(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Viscount57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn express for two nights during a short city break. the staff could not have been more helpful at the biggest 5 star hotel in town. You know what is on offer with this type of accomodation, ultra clean, basic and safe, but here the staff make a world of difference. they are kind, helpful, and always upbeat. If anyone wnats to have a relativly cheap stay in a wonderful city, with easy access to the metro, bus routes and all the tourist attractions, they could do far worse than book in here for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good good value for money although distant forn center”
Reviews.Author: hazinheira
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in November. It is situated outside the city center, in a neighborhood being renovated (not far frrm the old olympic village), where some industrial buildings can still be seen. There’s a metro station 5 mins away (count with 15 mins to reach Catalunya station) and 15 mins from the beach. The rooms are typical Holiday Inn standard, comfortable and clean. Staff was professional but a little “cold”. Breakfast, which was included in the daily rate, was good with variety of pastry, cereals, fresh fruit and eggs. If you’re looking for decent accommodation and do not require central location, this hotel offers a good good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattyboy_76
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff and great rooms and facilities for the price. Near to llacuna metro, supermarkets and restaurants, but not near the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Best time in Barcelona ever!!”
Reviews.Author: TimDeGroot
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our soccer team for 4 days @ the Holiday Inn. We had a morning training on the beach every day, so the location for that was great, just a 15 min. walk to the beach. The rooms were great and clean. The bathtub was quit slippery, it would be best to do something about that before somebody gets hurt! The service was not that good, since we had to bring our glasses back to the bar to get a new beer in the Hotel Lobby. The lady at the bar was not willing to give us new glasses or to wash the ones we brought back to get a new beer. For a private stay in Barcelona I would take a hotel more in the city center (with a cab it's 8 euros to the city center, which is cheap, but to far to walk) Over all our training camp was a success and with a big group the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel...Close to the Metro”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaHo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It was our first trip to Spain and the hotel staff made the transition easy for us. The front desk staff was helpful with directions, maps, and restaurant recommendations. The room was clean and comfortable. It was an easy walk to the beach or metro stop. The only downside to our trip was not following the age old advice of "let the buyer beware." We visited Park Güell and stopped at a shop just outside of the main gate. We purchased an Romero Britto figurine. When we returned to our great hotel, we studied the statue more closely and saw that it was made in China. Someone had gone to great lengths to cover up the made in China disclaimer on the bottom of the figurine. So, if you must purchase one of the items, order it from the internet. It is much cheaper. Other than that, it was a fabulous trip in a good clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again during my next visit”
Reviews.Author: kenpat123
Reviews.Content: Hello Readers, We spend 3 nights in this hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor. I am really happy with my stay and I will recommed to any tourist who want to stay with family. Pros:- - Near to Metro LLuana (2 blocks away or 100 meters from hotel) so you can go to any where. - Very Clean hotel (except carpet of hallway, but it is toursit like us do this). - Free breakfast. (Very good food). Kids will love it.!!!!!!!!!!!!!. Both ladies working there works very very hard to make this possible. No shortage of food. Very good supply chain maintain by both of them. - Excellent rooms for 2 Adults and 2 Kids. - Very good staff. (Even I checked in early morning they allow me breakfast for free and also store my luggage and help me explaining how to start in Barcelona). - Near to one of the biggest mall of Barcelona ( 4 blocks or 250 meters from hotel) where you can find Burger King, Mac Donalds, Subway and other fast food. Also one of the big super market is there so you can buy water and other grocery at very cheap rate. - Also it is near GREEN route (stop #10) of Barcelona Tour Bus(double decker) so you can go there in morning or use it while coming back. Thanks KP.

Reviews.Title: “Potential for great bargain - with the right expectations”
Reviews.Author: Travelmol
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for almost a week with our son and I am gladly recommend this hotel for a family holiday in Barcelona. I can not say I had a lot of interaction with hotel staff, but my check-in was quick and I saw them providing good advice to other guests of the hotel. Room is typical "new" Holiday Inn, LCD TV, no fridge, small table. Bathroom has bathub with shower. I know some people do not really like these soap dispensers, but I honestly do not care and in fact prefer them - I can use them throughout my stay and just leave Do not disturb sign on the door when I do not need any other things from the cleaners. While we there during a low season, the hotel was quite busy over the weekend. However, I could not hear any noise from other rooms, maybe just when someone bangs the door too loud. If you are very light sleeper, ask for the room facing the courtyard, but we were not bothered by some light noise in our room facing the street. As everybody mentioned, metro stop is just a few blocks away and T-10 (or even T-30) ticket is a great value for family or group. And do not miss Rambla Poblenou - some very nice cafes and pleasant stroll to the beach. It looks like the hotel has raised its price level (understandably),but I can see some great rates of about 55 euros - so I think it still is a great family bargain.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and brilliant staff......”
Reviews.Author: monty7580
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the hotel with a large group of friends for 3 nights....must say that we were very impressed by the hotel staff. They were very helpful and polite, especially a gentleman named Jordi, who talked us through things that we could do in the city. Locationwise the hotel was very good as it was quite close to the centre of the city. we didnt really eat at the hotel other than b/fast, which was OK as they only served continental b/fast. At times the lounge where bfast was served, did get really busy. The neighbouring area also has quiet a few good bars and the staff suggested an indian restaurant 5 mins. walk from the hotel which was the best food we had throughout the trip. Overall it was a great hotel with wonderful staff.... will definately go there again Monty

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean hotel close to metro . Unfrindly front desk ladies”
Reviews.Author: oudi
Reviews.Content: We are 3 adults and 3 children ( 15,11,7 ) The hotel as whole is good clean hotel every thing around you (supermarket and food ).The breakfast is good enough not too much not too little. The whole staff were queit working hard and polite ( specially the brakfast old lady) . But the problem for me was the unfriendly two ladies front desk who make my check in .They do not nothing about how to speak or deal with customers.They want you only to go your room ang get out of their face as if they pay for your stay.They refuse to put us on two double rooms with sofa bed as we booked and they say that the double room with no sofa bed is good for us( because our children are small enogh to sleep only in one sofa bed!!!) In my booking I asked also for close or connected rooms .But angrily they say no because we have repair work in the hotel so they could not find rooms as our booking. Thank God I have a print of my booking so they agreed to give us the rooms at last after long time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: sweet04
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights.Location is great , close to the beach and close to metro station.Hotel rooms are comfortable and clean.Breakfast is complimentary and there is a great variety.Staff at reception were very helpful especially Juan needs a special mention.Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, good breakfast but not all staff friendly and professional”
Reviews.Author: asia5100
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights, we had a good stay apart of one staff member that was unfriendly and unprofessional- Guest relation manager lady Myriam. She was more interested to finish her coffee in the back of the reception than help the guest. I found this very rude, unfriendly and not professional at all. Rest of the reception staff was lovely. Room was very clean, 2 single beds, good size bedroom and bathroom. The breakfast was nice but on the second day was not fresh fruits, tomatoes. The hotel is located 10 minutes walking distance to the seaside, but a bit far away from La Ramblas (use the underground). If you want to go to Park Guell use the bus number 92. I stayed 2 years ago in hotel ( not Holiday Inn) close to Pl.Cataluyna and was much more better, next time i will stay over there.

Reviews.Title: “Check that the aircon works”
Reviews.Author: Snookoafc1
Reviews.Content: The aircon in this perfectly reasonable Holiday Inn Express City-22 Barcelona was switched off because the staff said: "It's winter". It was 20 degrees outside and the sun shone on my room all day. It was a sauna. Reception told me it was 'impossible' to switch on the aircon and I should open the window. It opened maybe six inches and I had to leave the curtains open to get any air at all. That meant no privacy and street noise - and it was still hot. The next day I demanded a fan. They gave me a large fan that made a real racket! Net result: still no sleep. Before you use this hotel find out whether they are on a 'saving electricity campaign'. If they are, steer clear.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and good value in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: marcelosternick
Reviews.Content: Holiday inn express @22, Barcelona is a nice and confortable hotel. Good price, nice breakfast. A little bit distant from the main touristic areas, but close to metro station and Shopping Diagonal Mar.

Reviews.Title: “large clean room, comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: esueg
Reviews.Content: Hotel is about 2 blocks from the Llacuna subway stop on the L4 line. Large grocery very nearby, but no refrigerator in hotel room. A street with a few restaurants nearby, but nothing great. Hotel is very clean, large comfortable room and bed. Also very quiet. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “room very clean staff very helpful close to underground very good braekfast”
Reviews.Author: ikibarnea
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the hotel 24-30 sep 2010. needed room with 2 children aged 10 and 17. was a very good room. got a dbl bed and a sofa for the children.enjoyed breakfast. front desk staff was very friendly .5 min walk to llacuna metro station. not far from the beach . very nice street on the left side from the hotel with shops , restuarants and very nice sq and banches to seat.not far to go to catch the touristic bus red route. we had 2 days of bus touristic and used it very good. we arrived at places we had never go ourselves there, very recommedable.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel pity about the rugby scrum at breakfast”
Reviews.Author: wwhite
Reviews.Content: A remarkably quiet hotel on the edge of a residential district and a redevelopment area. Standard Holiday Inn. The only criticisms were that despite the 30 C heat , the ice machine was broken for the whole week that we were there and the rugby scrum that takes place after 8.30 am at breakfast. Too many guests in too small a breakfast buffet area.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: guest218
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and found this hotel unbearable, due to its misrepresentation on its website and the attitude of the staff. We both belong to the hospitality industry and we understand value for money and this was least to say anything close to it. We have travelled extensively and have never come across something so mismanaged and anti-guest orientated. The service was slow and unprofessional and the hotel over authorized our cards which made our holiday a terrible experience. I would never reccomend this hotel to anyone and would suggest looking at independant hotels in La Rambla which is what I'll be doing on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value somewhat away from the crowded tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: oompahdave
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights prior to a cruise. We liked the location, which is adjacent to a residential area and is a bit away from the busy (and much higher priced) tourist areas. The Metro is nearby, so it is easy to get around, particularly with a "Barcelona Card" giving access to the excellent Metro and public transportation. It is a 25 Euro taxi ride from the airport and 20 to the cruise ship docks. The hotel has modern, fairly typical Holiday Inn Express rooms, with reception on the second floor of what looks more like an office building in a business area. Two blocks away is a wonderful Rambla with lots of reasonably priced restaurants and shops, including a nearby supermarket. We much preferred that Rambla to the famous but tourist crowded and expensive La Rambla in the center of the city for shopping and dining. It is also a relatively short walk to the beautiful beaches. The free buffet breakfast is plentiful, but somewhat chaotic with an inefficient layout and lots of people. The only ice machine in the entire hotel was out of order and there were no ice buckets in the room. Both appear intentional - get used to Europe not having ice like American hotels. If you like walking and taking the Metro and want a comfortable reasonably priced clean hotel, and don't plan on spending lots of time there except for sleeping, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice but the staff could be more friendly”
Reviews.Author: bncav
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Holiday Inn Barcelona for 4 nights during a convention in the city. The hotel itself is a good choice, being cheaper than hotels close to the Convention Center and others close to the beaches or the Ramblas. Moreover, the subway is only two blocks away, allowing you to go virtually anywhere both for tourism or business. The rooms are pretty standard, what is good, clean and silent. The downsides are the price for the Wi-FI internet (18.00 Euros/day!!!) and the front desk staff, which, with few exceptions, are almost rude and are not willing to help anybody. Summing up, a good choice for Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Steve88
Reviews.Content: Went to Barca for a big conference and booked this hotel to save tax payers money. Arrived around noon, Jennifer checked me in on the 6th floor (top) without problem. The view from my room is not spactacular but the room is quiet (I only needed that there). Lobby and breakfast area is hot, as well as hallways and in the tiny elevators (3 of them), where there is no air conditioning. The room is comfortable, clean, with great water pressure. Breakfast is served until 10:00 AM, with everything except eggs, bacon, or sausages that boost your cardiovascular risks. The beds are hard, maybe good for your back. No fridge or safety box in the room, so put all the valuables in the safety box with front desk. The staff members are great, especially Jennifer, all of them speak good English. Exchange rate is high at the hotel, I changed my USD in a bank nearby (not La Caixa), where only one staff speaks English, others appeared hated any extra work. The metro is 2 blocks away (Llacuna), which is not in the best neighborhood. But you can walk toward the opposite direction for 3 blocks to another metro station Poblenou though. The beach is not very close, about 20-30 minute walk, I was soaked when I reached the beach. There is a very nice (expensive) restaurant 3 block from Llacuna station, great service, but food is so so. If you turn left from the hotel gate and walk one block, there are several places to eat and a supermarket. People are friendly but they don’t speak English. Overall, it is nice to stay in a local hotel and see how locals live.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to explore a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: iwanttogoonholiday
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for 3 nights in June and really enjoyed ourselves. The hotel is very clean and modern, and whilst it's not in the centre of Barcelona, the metro is only just around the corner and it's only a few stops in. It's a quiet 'up and coming' area so it was nice to be able to leave the hotel without stepping straight into a frantic throng of people. If you're planning on using the sightseeing bus, this stops just a few blocks away too so that was handy. It's also nice to be able to walk down to the seafront from the hotel. Our room was spacious and well-equipped (nice powerful shower too) and breakfast was great! Lots of variety and very yummy! We loved Barcelona and this was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Biyani
Reviews.Content: Overall service is outstanding! The staffs are very friendly and helpful. Exceptional restaurant with superb breakfast. ‎ The rooms were very clean, especially the bathroom. It is a great hotel for a vacationer to spend some time with his family.‎ The hotel location is also good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Drufasa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here because it was close to the cruise ship port. We arrived at 12pm, and even though check in time is 2pm - they were still able to give us a room. (Nice, but not unheard of) We then stayed another night after our cruise, and arrived at 9am - and they STILL gave us a room! (Not just nice, but completely unheard of) The desk staff were very helpful with questions regarding the immediate area (IE: restaurants, stores, etc) and were able to call a taxi service for us to arrive at the time we needed. I would stay at this hotel again just because of the people that work there.

Reviews.Title: “Some tips on this nice, useful place in Barcelona sub-center.”
Reviews.Author: NLoriel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a standard, newly refurbished Holiday Express, which means you can expect high cleanliness, rather nice rooms (in fact, the room was so exactly a copy of the one we stayed in Madrid that on the first morning I wasn't sure where I am) and adequate service. You can easily get to/from the airport using one trip off your T-10 TMB ticket and switching between the train and metro on Passeig de Gràcia station (though take care as there are some changes impending as the link to the airport is being expanded). Just take care not to enter the railway platform (ticket turnstiles) at the airport when the train has *just* left, as the next one will be in 30 mins and this may mean a tight fit time-wise. The hotel is about 7 mins from the metro station, which means you have an easy access to anywhere in the town. There is a supermarket and a new promenade (Rambla del Poblenou) one block to the east, plus a number of shops selling both fashion and fruits. The whole district of the city is being refurbished which creates some strange contrasts - remains of old factories and previous street network meet new buildings and squares. An interesting experience. The eastern windows of the hotel overlook a new school with a football field on the roof. It's interesting, but could be a bit noisy (though the windows are okay at dampening the sound). The hotel itself looked a bit crowded, which made breakfasts a bit of a challenge, but hey, you don't come to HI Express to stay in the room, right? If you're looking for a bigger mall, there's Centre Commercial Diagonal Mar about 15 mins (walking) to the north-east. There's also a nice promenade along the coast, though it was still partially under construction in Dec 2009. And that would be it. We spent a couple of days there when scouting Barcelona for the first time and would seriously consider this place for a second trip.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel, Good value for money, Far from center”
Reviews.Author: ronari2
Reviews.Content: Had a standard room for 4 nights (went to see Formula1 race). We choosed this hotel since we had a car and we needed parking in resounable price and quick exit to the high way. For this purpose the hotel was excelent. It is far from city center (5 subway stations, ~20minutes including walking from the hotel to the nearest subway station, 3 blocks). The hotel have good rooms, the breakfast is very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Not central but handy for most that good in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SomersetKeithers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we were a group and knew a Holiday Inn would provide us a reasonable standard of accomidation and the price was cheaper than many of the city centre hotels. The continental breakfast was plentiful though there was a queue at times.The bedroom was clean and tidy and at a standard that I would expect from a large chain. Though not central the nearest beach was only a 15 minute walk and the closest Metro station 5 minutes away, buy a T10 ticket for the Metro, it covers Zone 1 which envelopes most of the main attractions for 7.95 euros. Barcelona is a beautiful city with a good beach scene, just beware of the pickpockets in busy places ie. Las Ramblas, Metro and Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, handy location and helpful staff in difficult times!”
Reviews.Author: TKCheltenham
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel before the volcanic ash air flight ban and were warmly welcomed by reception staff.
