The rooms are clean and modern and the inclusive breakfast makes this hotel good value for money. The hotel is one street away from Poblenou Rambla which was pleasant. There was a lot of construction near the hotel however this was not an issue noise wise whilst we were there. The hotel is close to a shopping and eating centre with a large Carrefour supermarket so there are plenty of amenities close at hand. When we were stranded due to the flight ban and were unsure of departure the staff could not have been more helpful. In particular Jordi and Albert went out of their way to help us if they could. Great service at a time when it was needed and appreciated most. If I were travelling to Barcelona again I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: msvoboda11
Reviews.Content: Close to public transport (Llacuna metro station), 5 minute walking distance from the beach. Close to party area Port Olympic, which comes in handy with cab fare on the way back ;-) Very good service, reception advised us where to go for the tourist bus route (very recommended as well). Tidy and clean hotel, as I expected, but nice that in reality this was also the case.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: shaun_balzan
Reviews.Content: We were treated just Perfect .. The staff went out of their way to help us each time. Will def go back again. A small walk away from the beach and the tube. Room was clean, comfy and had everything you need. Beds and pillows were nice and comfy. All in all a great hotel to be in.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, great freebies but off the main tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: Inspector_to_be
Reviews.Content: A new hotel, well appointed, with no frills but yet comfortable and clean. Free internet and also breakfast were great value adds. What you see is what you get – and I guess that when you’re using the hotel to sleep only, that’s not a bad thing. The location isn’t that fabulous, but it wont stop you from sightseeing if that’s what you’re there to do. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & Clean Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wildriceman
Reviews.Content: Three nights using our priority points and very well spent. The buffet breakfast was the best of the many Express by Holiday Inns I have stayed at. The room was clean and the hotel is only two blocks from the closest Metro station. The area is being developed and a little noisy in the morning. A safe and pleasant area for families, couples or single visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bazman10
Reviews.Content: We stayed her last summer. We found it to be great value. Really close to metro station, so easy to get around Barcelona. Breakfast was good, rooms are air conditioned, nicely decorated and clean. If I was returning to Barcelona I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Xtraboy
Reviews.Content: Clean, Not expensive, Modern, Minimal design, near Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Too warm in the room, uncomfortable beds, and moldy smell”
Reviews.Author: Kellious
Reviews.Content: This was my daughter's first trip to Europe and we selected this hotel both from the reviews on trip advisor and the thought that a Holiday Inn would be less culture shock than a smaller privately owned hotel. Big mistake. The room was warm the entire 5 night stay and even after speaking with the front desk there was nothing that could be done since the heat had already been turned on for the season. Evidently once that happens there is no fan or cooling option. Most evenings my husband, daughter, and I woke up sweating because it was too warm, even after having left windows open. In addition, the windows did not have any screens and there were mosquitos that would come in if we left the window open. The bed was worn and not comfortable at all - if it hadn't been for the time difference and being tired after sightseeing, I'm not sure we would have been able to sleep. The bathroom was the largest I've seen in a European hotel (that was good) however it smelled of mildew and every time we returned to the room it took a good 10-15 minutes before the smell subsided. In addition, the configuration of the shower and shower wall was awkward and resulted almost every time in water all over the floor. The cleaning service was wonderful and the included breakfast was more than adequate, which were the only 2 good things about this hotel. The location was just as described here - a little far from the main areas, but close enough by public transportation. A little industrial looking but we felt safe in the 3 block walk to the metro station. We all enjoyed Barcelona and hope to return but will not stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “7 euros into the city”
Reviews.Author: pravi1
Reviews.Content: great price, only 7 euros into plasca de catalyuna, it is not in the city, but for the price you pay, you wont regret, im from london and the staff speak good english and so do cab drivers, try not to bring a bag in the cab or you will get charged an extra 3 euros

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Lightman7
Reviews.Content: Typical Holiday Inn Express - no surprises as far as amenities (check in desk spoke decent english, free breakfast, etc.). Carpets (both hallway and room) could have been cleaner. Two internet PCs in the lobby were functional but so infected with viruses and spyware that you wouldn't want to use them to access anything that required you to input personal information. The hotel is two blocks from the Metro (in a non-tourist area), so getting around was very convenient. Full supermarket one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: NordicVagabond
Reviews.Content: Perhaps not ideally situated but otherwise pretty decent property. For the price you get adequate value. To be honest, hotel has exactly the standard an average tourist should look for. How many hours of your awake time one is in the hotel? Acceptable breakfast, neat and clean, well-maintained rooms, what more does one need? For instance there was no minibar in the room? I never use them even if there is one, so it has no importance/function for me? The same goes for several other “amenities”. To sum up, a good hotel for touristing families.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Aathony
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, ( Thurs & Friday), before leaving for a cruise. Took the airport bus to the city centre at 4.50 euro each, then a taxi for 20 euro. ( included 2 heavy cases). The hotel is situated on the fringe of the city centre, in the area called Poblenou. Its a mixed residential/commercial area, with a lot of redevelopment work going on. The hotel & facilities are classic Holiday Inn Express. Totally functional. Bar, breakfast room, & reception are on the first floor. There is an additional seating area on the ground floor. The building is modern, I would guess only a few years old. Our room was a standard double, with ensuite shower & wc, ac, tv, hospitality tray, desk, couch & adequate storage. It was comfortable & clean, & being at the side of the building, very quiet.. One minor drawback is no in-room safe. Receptionists were very friendly, & gave us directions to the metro & shops. We also purchased our Bus Turistic tickets from them at a small discount over the set price. Continental Breakfast is included in the room rate, & is presented buffet style. There was a good choice. Timing is everything here as It can get very busy. We took breakfast at about 8.30 & took our trays into the bar area which was always quiet. Free internet access up to 20 minutes is available from 2 PCs in reception. Very useful. The walk to the nearest metro station at Llacuna is about 10 minutes. Its an interesting stroll, as the area is a hive of activity. Small workshops, all manor of retail shops, modern offices & residential blocks. We did this walk a total of 4 times, including twice at night, & it felt safe. Never experienced any problems & found local people to be very friendly. We purchased single tickets from the machines at about 1.50 euro each. Instructions were in english & easy to follow. Trains were every few minutes, & clean, & it took about 15/20 minutes to the centre. We found it incredibly convenient & easier to navigate the metro than we thought it would be. Turn left out of the hotel, & in less than 5 minutes you are on the Rambla del Poblenou. This is a lovely tree lined street, with a supermarket, shops, bars & restaurants. You can follow it to the sea & beaches, taking around 15 minutes. This appears to be where the locals hang out. We walked down here on a Saturday morning, & it crowded with shoppers & the pavement cafes busy with breakfasts & coffees . All in all, we were pleased with this hotel. Its funtional, good value for money, & although the location away from the city centre may put some people off, we found that by using the metro, or a taxi, you could be at the Placa de Catalunya in no time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel not so lovely location”
Reviews.Author: Caryne
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is new and very well maintained. The staff are generally very helpful (except the one who told me to 'look on the internet' when I asked for advice about an attraction!!) and the rooms are a good size and very clean. As in all Holiday Inn Express a buffet breakfast is inlcuded in the price and there is a good choice of food in a well appointed room. The problem with this hotel is the location, I guess it could be called 'up and coming' as there is clearly a lot of development/building work going on arounfd the hotel (starting at 7am ever day, including Saturday, so keep your windows closed if you are a light sleeper!!). However, at the moment there is a lot of run down properties in the area and some very dubious people hanging around, including one who followed us from the Metro to the hotel and women who looked very much like prostitutes hanging around the Metro entrance in the evening. There is also an awful lot of dog mess on the streets which is not always easy to avoid! If I was a single women there is no way I would want to walk from the Metro to the hotel at night, even though it is only a five minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “What a Find!”
Reviews.Author: smartgrandpa
Reviews.Content: We were quite anxious to find a good hotel for our first ever week-long visit to Barcelona and we settled on this Holiday Inn Express primarily because info we had gleaned said that it provided free breakfast. After a long and dreary flight, we arrived to a greeting that made us feel welcome - the room was bright and airy, with a very large window that we could open sufficiently to about 6 inches. The bathroom was modern, with a nice bath and shower. There was a nice liquid soap dispenser for the sink and a shower gel dispenser for the tub. When came time for breakfast...WOW! Juice and coffee at profusion, cereals a plenty, and croissants were the best we ever had anywhere! What a great way to start the day in view of the long walks in this beatiful city. At the end of the day, we were able to check our email for a free 15 min. period at one of the two desktops provided by the hotel, take a nice glass of Catalan wine at the bar before going to a nice restaurant on the Poblenou Ramblas, a block away from the hotel. We must add that all the personnel were very courteous and helpful to all our requests. all in all, what a find this hotel was. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent location....amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Khairem
Reviews.Content: This was our honeymoon trip and first time to Europe. We were catching a cruise 2 days after we arrived, and stayed at this hotel. The staff at check in was great, even though we got in very early and our room wasn't quite ready yet. When we did get our room shortly after, it was very clean, well stocked and comfortable....but a bit warm. The location on the hotel is perfect. There is a grocery store a block away that has everything you need, and on the same block, an entire area of great resteraunts, shops and stores. The Metro is just a few blocks away, and we easily found our way to Las Ramblas and the other tourist sites. As far as the staff at the hotel, they were VERY helpful even though the hotel was extremely busy. Jordi was the best!! He gave us so much help finding our way around, and getting us resteraunt recommendations, ect. He always had a great attitude and an enthusiasm for helping us, as we were newbies to the whole European experience. It is a bit of a ride from the airport, but the cab ride only cost us about 20 Euro, and the cab to the cruise terminal was painless and not costly either. Highly recommended hotel....we will definetly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean adequate facilities a little way outside the main centre”
Reviews.Author: martida
Reviews.Content: A new hotel offering basic but adequate Holiday Inn Express type facilities. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms typical of this type of hotel - clean but functional. Breakfast is a plentiful cold buffet of pastries, cold meats and cheeses - but was overly busy at 09:00 during the autumn school holiday period. The hotel itself is a short metro ride away from the city centre itself on the L4 line from which you can alight at the Barceolneta stop for the port and beach or a couple of stops further to Urquinaona for Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas. This is nore more than a 10 minute ride from the local Llancuna metro stop but don't be fooled that this is a city centre hotel as it isn't. The hotel is in the upcoming 22@ district which has a feel of urban regeneration about it but seemed to be perfect;lu safe even late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Free Breakfast, Remote Location”
Reviews.Author: GCTourist
Reviews.Content: The location is not the best, but the subway is three blocks away. The location is remote and not many people on the street; especially in the evening. It was not an unsafe feeling, just remote. The hotel was clean and quiet. The rooms were very, very small. The breakfast was great. It had everything you could want. Nothing was cooked to order, but there was an outstanding variety of food. The lobby had free internet service. The desk clerks were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Barcelona but you feel like you're far away...”
Reviews.Author: sasandtim
Reviews.Content: After staying closer to Montjuic, we moved to the Holiday Inn Express for our last couple of days in Barcelona. The location was a totally different feel - a quiet neighborhood (with a lot of empty lots) made for surroundings which felt like they were in a somewhat run-down neighborhood. From the hotel, you'd never guess that the beach was only a few blocks away. The metro was nearby though we had to change lines for most of the attractions that we wanted to see. In fact, the hotel was willing to keep our bags after check out but it was so inconvenient to return, we actually took our bags with us. The rooms and bathrooms were both clean and the continental breakfast was good (though it only had cold options). There are also two computers in the lobby where you can check email for free which is good since it cost 10EUR/24 hours for wi-fi in the rooms. All in all, a nice place to stop over if you need a place to stay for a couple of days or have hotel points to spend though I wouldn't recommend it for a romantic holiday away. It's nice enough but certainly not luxury...

Reviews.Title: “One Night break well worth it”
Reviews.Author: MrsReidy
Reviews.Content: Check in to this hotel wasn't nice. The Girl on the front desk seemed Bored and not really in the mood to deal with us. The Hotel lobby is small but clean . Althought this hotel is new. its wearign badly. The hallways are dull and the carpets need a good clean. The Rooms are a good size, but once again the carpet was stained and needed a good clean. the bathrooms were spotless . the beds were very comfy and a good size. the hotel is only 5/10 mins walk from the beach. 5 euro in a taxi to the las rampas area. I think for the price that i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable! Location not so good.”
Reviews.Author: edu_cavalcanti
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Clean, comfortable and modern rooms (Flat LCD screen with large variety of channels). Nice continental breakfast. Only downside is the location. The hotel is two blocks away from the nearest metro station (Llacuna), which is several stops from some of the main attractions in the city (Plaza De Catalunya, Las Ramblas, etc.). However, its is pretty close to a nice Rambla (Rambla de Poblenou), where you can have wonderful catalan meals for a reasonable price (besides the pleasant walk towards the beach). Also, hotel could have free internet connection in rooms. Would definitely stay tthere again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: UKonthego
Reviews.Content: My friends booked for us to stay at this hotel for 4 nights. I wasn't expecting much from this hotel as I normally stay at Starwood hotels but boy, was I impressed. The hotel is not in the city center but it is very easy to get there using the underground. The hotel is in a safe area and there are a few nice restaurants close by. It is also easy to walk to the sea front from the hotel. The staff was super nice and check-in/check-out was really quick and easy. The front desk agent assigned us a room next to our friends, which was great! The breakfast was amazing! There was such an array of food and it was frequently replenished. The rooms are modern and very clean. I would certainly recommend this hotel and would stay there again if I go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Basic, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dramaqueen50
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just two weeks ago with my husband, daughter, son-in-law and their four children aged 6mths-8yrs. They could only give me 2 rooms to fit 2 adults and 2 children, which worked out fine. There was a sofa bed in each one and when we asked for a cot they said it could only take the sofa bed but not both but were happy to take the sofa bed out and put in a cot if we wanted. They were extremely friendly and we were very fortunate the baby is easily settled anywhere and he slept in sofa bed with his brother. It was very clean and modern and the breakfast was great. Not a massive selection but plenty to give you a good continental breakfast. Its a bit far from Las Ramblas but if you turn left when you come out of the hotel, go accross the road and up that street you come to a supermarket and all along there is a mini ramblas which was lovely. As it turned out it was much better for us as the big main streets were a bit too busy for kids. The food along that street though wasnt very nice mostly chips, pizza and burgers, in fact the only real decent meal we got in Barcelona was Hard Rock Cafe. Saying that we were catering for children too and if it had just been adults we could have found loads of lovely restaurants. If you have children go to the Aquarium its quite expensive but worth it. If you fly by Easyjet, keep your boarding passes it gets you 3 euros off the entrance price. Btw its also near the beach you just turn right onto that main street and go straight. The hotel gave me a map on my second request!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Accomadations”
Reviews.Author: Floridatravelfiend_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for two nights. It cost about 35 Euros from the Barcelona airport. We had booked it thinking it would be very close to the port in which our cruise was leaving from, but that was not the case, and the port we left from was far away. (At least 40 euros!) It's a nice hotel, clean, modern, with a nice English proficient staff. The lobby even offers 15 minute free internet browsing, which was nice. The breakfast included was mediocre....the coffee was hideous and the food left us feeling slightly ill with mailaise. The neighborhood was not the best....we would not feel comfortable at night walking around. However, lots of neat cafes and a supermarket are closeby.
